author: gcolvin
content:
<@!433705373070000138>  "relatively competitive to precompiled in the use of elliptic curves"
My take has always been that an extended EVM can be made relatively competitive to native code.  But testing shows it takes a compiler to approach native C, and that optimizing compilers are a DoS vector. And those gas fees have to be counted.  So the EVM will always be at some disadvantage here, but I can't say how much.  I think @axic is in a position to make measurements.   (And I've heard some stuff requires assembly.)
